statements.name: PROC PRINQUAL
statements.description: The PRINQUAL procedure performs principal component analysis (PCA) of qualitative, quantitative, or mixed data.

arguments.name: APPROXIMATIONS
arguments.description: Includes principal component approximations to the transformed variables in the output data set.

arguments.name: APREFIX=
arguments.description: Specifies a prefix for naming the approximation variables. By default, APREFIX=A.

arguments.name: CCONVERGE=
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum change in the criterion being optimized that is required to continue iterating. By default, CCONVERGE=0.0.

arguments.name: CHANGE=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of the first iteration to be displayed in the iteration history table. The default is CHANGE=1.

arguments.name: CONVERGE=
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum average absolute change in standardized variable scores that is required to continue iterating. By default, CONVERGE=0.00001.

arguments.name: CORRELATIONS
arguments.description: Includes correlations and the component structure matrix in the output data set. By default, this information is not included.

arguments.name: COVARIANCE
arguments.description: Computes the principal components from the covariance matrix.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Specifies the SAS data set to be analyzed.

arguments.name: DUMMY
arguments.description: Expands variables specified for OPSCORE optimal transformations to dummy variables for the initialization.

arguments.name: INITITER=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of MAC iterations required to initialize the data before starting MTV or MGV iterations. By default, INITITER=0.

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations. By default, MAXITER=30.

arguments.name: MDPREF
arguments.description: Specifies a multidimensional preference analysis by implying the STANDARD, SCORES, and CORRELATIONS options.

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies the optimization method. By default, METHOD=MTV.

arguments.name: MAC
arguments.description: Maximum average correlation

arguments.name: MGV
arguments.description: Minimum generalized variance

arguments.name: MTV
arguments.description: Maximum total variance

arguments.name: MONOTONE=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of principal components to be computed. By default, N=2.

arguments.name: N=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of principal components to be computed. By default, N=2.

arguments.name: NOCHECK
arguments.description: Turns off computationally intensive numerical error checking for the MGV method.

arguments.name: NOMISS
arguments.description: Excludes all observations with missing values from the analysis, but does not exclude them from the OUT= data set.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of all output.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Specifies an output SAS data set that contains results of the analysis. If you omit the OUT= option, PROC PRINQUAL still creates an output data set and names it by using the DATA convention.

arguments.name: PLOTS=
arguments.description: Controls the plots produced through ODS Graphics. Syntax: (1) PLOTS <(global-plot-options)> <= plot-request <(options)>> (2) PLOTS <(global-plot-options)> <= (plot-request <(options)> <... plot-request <(options)>>)> The global plot options include the following: FLIP |FLI flips or interchanges the X-axis and Y-axis dimension for MDPREF plots. INTERPOLATE | INT uses observations that are excluded from the analysis for interpolation in the fit and transformation plots. ONLY | ONL suppresses the default plots. Only plots specifically requested are displayed.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Produces all appropriate plots.

arguments.name: TRANSFORMATION
arguments.description: Plots the variable transformations. By default, multiple plots can appear in some output panels. Specify UNPACKPANEL to display each plot in a separate panel.

arguments.name: MDPREF
arguments.description: Plots multidimensional preference analysis results.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of all graphics output.

arguments.name: PREFIX=
arguments.description: Specifies a prefix for naming the principal components. By default, the names are Prin1, Prin2, ..., Prinn.

arguments.name: REFRESH=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of variables to scale in the MGV method before computing a new inverse. By default, REFRESH=5.

arguments.name: REITERATE
arguments.description: Enables PROC PRINQUAL to use previous transformations as starting points.

arguments.name: REPLACE
arguments.description: Replaces the original data with the transformed data in the output data set.

arguments.name: SCORES
arguments.description: Includes principal component scores in the output data set. By default, scores are not included.

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the singularity criterion, where 0 < p < 1.

arguments.name: STANDARD
arguments.description: Standardizes the principal component scores in the output data set to mean zero and variance one instead of the default mean zero and variance equal to the corresponding eigenvalue.

arguments.name: TPREFIX=
arguments.description: Specifies a prefix for naming the transformed variables. By default, TPREFIX=T.

arguments.name: TSTANDARD=
arguments.description: Specifies the standardization of the transformed variables in the OUT= data set.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: Centers the output variables to mean zero, but the variances are the same as the variances of the input variables.

arguments.name: NOMISS
arguments.description: Sets the means and variances of the transformed variables in the OUT= data set, computed over all output values that correspond to nonmissing values in the input data set, to the means and variances computed from the nonmissing observations of the original variables.

arguments.name: ORIGINAL
arguments.description: Sets the means and variances of the transformed variables to the means and variances of the original variables. This is the default.

arguments.name: Z
arguments.description: Standardizes the variables to mean zero, variance one.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the valid value for the _TYPE_ variable in the input data set. If PROC PRINQUAL finds an input _TYPE_ variable, it uses only observations with a _TYPE_ value that matches the TYPE= value.

arguments.name: UNTIE=
arguments.description: Specifies the first and last special missing values in the list of those special missing values that are to be estimated with within-variable order constraints but no category constraints. The two-letters value must consist of two letters in alphabetical order.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Obtains separate analyses on observations in groups defined by the BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: If one variable in the input data set represents the frequency of occurrence for other values in the observation, list the variable’s name in a FREQ statement. PROC PRINQUAL then treats the data set as if each observation appeared n times, where n is the value of the FREQ variable for the observation.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: The ID statement includes additional character or numeric variables in the output data set. The variables must be contained in the input data set.

statements.name: TRANSFORM
statements.description: The TRANSFORM statement lists the variables to be analyzed (variables) and specifies the transformation (transform) to apply to each variable listed.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: Centers the output variables to mean zero, but the variances are the same as the variances of the input variables.

arguments.name: NOMISS
arguments.description: Sets the means and variances of the transformed variables in the OUT= data set, computed over all output values that correspond to nonmissing values in the input data set, to the means and variances computed from the nonmissing observations of the original variables.

arguments.name: ORIGINAL
arguments.description: Sets the means and variances of the transformed variables to the means and variances of the original variables. This is the default.

arguments.name: Z
arguments.description: Standardizes the variables to mean zero, variance one.

statements.name: WEIGHT
statements.description: When you use a WEIGHT statement, a weighted residual sum of squares is minimized. The WEIGHT statement has no effect on degrees of freedom or number of observations, but the weights affect most other calculations.
